alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 4:58AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: Low pressure will move into the Gulf of Alaska Tuesday morning, bringing widespread heavy rain along with strong winds through Thursday. Confidence is high on strong gusts greater than 40 mph along with widespread rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches across the region. Strong winds from this storm combined with saturated soils will also bring concerns for tree falls, mainly along river banks at this time. Care should be taken now to test bilge pumps and make vessels ready for long periods of heavy rain. This is an evolving and changing situation. Stay tuned to the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau and on social media.
